document_data.name: Old Draconic
document_data.mainbody: '''Old Draconic''', sometimes referred to as '''Auld Wyrm''' or '''Auld Wyrmish''',{{Cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2008)/10-27 - What is Old Draconic}}{{Cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2008)/10-27 - Use of Old Draconic in Spellcasting}}
document_data.Derivations:
* The trade tongue of the [[sarrukh]] used a script that utilized a smattering of [[Thorass language|Thorass]] and quite significantly Old Draconic. This same script was later used to write the ''[[Nether Scrolls]]''.
* For much of [[Toril]]'s history, mages wrote their [[spell]]s in an everchanging "pidgin language" or "jargon" derived from Old Draconic, utilizing many of its articles and verbs. This script was augmented by various runes or sigils, which individually carried their own meanings and magical charges. Around 12% of the language in total consisted of words borrowed from Old Draconic.
document_data.History: Dating back to as far as the [[Dawn Age]], for much of Toril's ancient history a variety of different cultures and creatures, including the [[giant]]s, made some use of Old Draconic.{{Cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2008)/10-27 - Old Draconic, Window Screens, and Masks of the Moonstone Mask}}<ref group="note" name="age">This age can be inferred by [[Ed Greenwood]] naming "the [[giant]] races, or the [[titan]]s" as the contemporary races that would have possibly utilized the Old Draconic script.
document_data.Notable Readers: * [[Filfaeril Obarskyr]] could read Old High Wyrm.<ref>{{Cite web/Realmslore/Everyday Writing in the Realms (Part One)}}
